title: Update Collections section copy and add Request Samples email CTA

requirements.text: Update the Collections section content within the selected element (/html/body/div/div/main/section[3]/div[1]) to match the provided copy, including heading, subheading, four collection cards (title, description, and tags), a closing line, and a “Request Samples” CTA button that opens the user’s email app.

quotes: Manufactured to suit residential, hospitality, and commercial interiors.
All collections can be customized for size, color, and project requirements.
CTA button: “Request Samples” ( which opens up email app )

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/sections/CollectionsSection.tsx, the section heading text is exactly “Carpet Collections for Design-Led Projects”.
In frontend/src/components/sections/CollectionsSection.tsx, the section subheading text is exactly “Manufactured to suit residential, hospitality, and commercial interiors.”

The four collection cards display the following titles and descriptions in order: (1) “Machine-Made Carpet Rolls” with description “Efficient. Consistent. Project-friendly. Wall-to-wall carpet rolls ideal for large areas, offering uniform finish, reliable lead times, and cost efficiency for scale projects.”; (2) “Modular Carpet Tiles” with description “Flexible layouts, easy maintenance. Perfect for offices and commercial spaces where design flexibility, replacement ease, and durability matter.”; (3) “Handmade Carpets” with description “Crafted character for signature spaces. Handmade carpets developed with attention to texture, material, and detailing—ideal for bespoke residential and hospitality projects.”; (4) “Jute Carpets” with description “Natural texture, sustainable appeal. Eco-conscious jute carpets that bring warmth and organic character to modern interiors.”

Each card renders its tag list as three visible tag pills matching the provided tags: (1) “Custom widths”, “Consistent quality”, “Bulk supply”; (2) “Mix & match”, “Easy replacement”, “Commercial use”; (3) “Custom designs”, “Wool & viscose”, “Premium finish”; (4) “Natural fiber”, “Sustainable”, “Earthy aesthetics”.
A closing line appears below the collection cards that reads exactly: “All collections can be customized for size, color, and project requirements.”

A visible CTA button labeled exactly “Request Samples” appears below the closing line and uses a mailto: link so it opens the user’s email app (use the existing CONTACT.email value from frontend/src/config/contact.ts).
No other sections outside the Collections section are modified.

constraints: Apply changes only to the selected element corresponding to the Collections section container (/html/body/div/div/main/section[3]/div[1]); do not modify other sections/components beyond what is required to implement this content and CTA.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend (Motoko) must remain a single-actor architecture; no backend changes are required for this content update.
nonGoals: Adding new backend endpoints or persistence for sample requests.
Implementing a contact form or sending emails server-side (mailto: only).
Changing gallery assets or generating new images for the collections section.
